data.title: Sourav Chandidas Ganguly
data.text: Sourav Chandidas Ganguly, former Indian cricketer is the youngest son of Chandidas and Nirupa Ganguly. Chandidas was a well-known man as the founder of a flourishing and long-running printing press as well as one of the richest men of Kolkata. Born from a well-known family, Saurav had access to cricket and major facilities at an early stage. Initially, like other residents in Kolkata Ganguly was fond of football, his elder brother Snehasish was an established cricketer in the Bengal Cricket team. He took after his brother and soon enrolled in a cricket academy where he learned batting. He debuted for Bengal in 1989, the same year when his brother was dropped. He made his ODI debut with ICT in 1992 where he scored 3 runs and later was dropped from the team. He was recalled against England in 1996 where he came under media scrutiny. He was part of the playing XI in the 2nd test at Lords where he scored a century and became only 3rd Indian to do so. In the 1999 World Cup, he scored 183 off 158 in an innings which was the 2nd highest score in World Cup history. He got married to Classical Dancer Dona Ganguly and had a beautiful daughter Sana Ganguly. In the 1999-2000s, he was impressive with his scores and attracted many eyeballs. It was the same time when controversy broke out that he was romantically involved with actress Nagma. In 2000 after a match fixing scandal by some players in the Indian team, he was announced as captain. In 2001, India playing against Australia won a historic match where Ganguly took off his shirt in Public. This incident is one of the highlights in the cricket world, he was later condemned for his act. He has achieved significant success and is known as one of the successful captains of India. He joined KKR in 2008 as a captain and was later replaced in 2009. He retired from the Indian team in 2008 and became a TV host for a quiz show called Dadagiri Unlimited. He served as IPL Spot fixing a justice panel from 2015 to 2019, as advisor of Delhi Capitals in 2019, and as BCCI president in 2019. He is an Arjuna Award and Padma Shri holder for his contribution to Indian cricket. He ventured into business through the steel factory Salboni and his cricket academy. He is truly an inspiring personality and continues to be part of the cricket world as an Indian commentator and mentor for the IPL franchise.
